result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Rodin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before  March 10, 2015.  May serve in Dane Co.  Out of county travel per jail rules for work purposes.  Defendant has 2 days credit if probation revoked.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include sex offender treatment/assessment.   No contact w/SMJ or any member of her family.  No unsupervised contact w/any females under 18.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence/commitment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant James M. Rodin in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states case and appearances.  State states majority of dispo is agreed to and states that agreement/parties are arguing any jail sentence.  State makes their argument re: jail sentence.  Parties have all reviewed the VIS filed.  Atty Covey responds/argues against jail sentence.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences him.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings, voting right and appeal rights.  Doctors reports and VIS be sealed.

Ct 1:  NC
36 months probation
Conditions of probation:
Sex offender treatment/assessment and any other counseling per agent
No contact w/S.M.J. or any member of her family
No unsupervised contact w/any females under 18 
$518.00 costs/DNA surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution of $501.00 to the victim and her mother (stip filed) plus all applicable surcharges
45 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 3/10/2015 at 6:30 pm
May serve in Dane Co if accepted per jail rules
Out of county travel per jail rules for work purposes
EMP approved per jail rules
2 days sentence credit to be applied only if revoked
DE to report to P&P by 4pm today
Cash bond to be applied
Sentencing hearing on January 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant James M. Rodin in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea today, however argued sentencing with Br. 1 re: jail time.  State moves to amend 948.10(1)(a).  Plea to amended charge.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Argued jail time.  Attorney Covey agrees with all conditions and will be arguing jail time.  Court goes through plea questionnaire and constitutional rights with defendant orally.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty.  Matter to be set for argued sentencing Br. 1.
Final pre-trial on November 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James M. Rodin in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.  Bond continues.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading

Defendant James M. Rodin in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court finds factual basis felony was committed.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Application

14R 017192
No contact w/SMJ; No contact w/any females under 18 except incidental contact for work purposes

Pre-trial conference on August 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant James M. Rodin appeared by video means with Steve Hughes and Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant goes qualify.  State request $500.00 cash bond.  No objection to conditions.  No contact with S.M.J.   Hughes gives status and criminal history/warrant status.  Defendant is employed and has ties to the community.  Request low cash.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.   Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with any females under the age of 18 years except incidental contact for work purposes.  No contact with S.M.J. 8/10/98  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
